buy_conditions: Retail sentiment index shows a significant drop (e.g., below 30 on a scale of 0-100) while institutional sentiment index remains stable or increases
Technical indicator: RSI (Relative Strength Index) for retail favorites is above 70, indicating overbought conditions
Fundamental catalyst: Recent earnings report for institutional picks beats expectations by more than 10%
exit_conditions: Profit target reached: 15% gain on the position
Stop loss triggered: 5% loss from the entry price
Market condition change: Major economic news release (e.g., interest rate decision) causes volatility in the market
Fundamental deterioration: Institutional pick shows signs of declining revenue growth in the latest quarterly report

opportunities.opportunity: SPY momentum divergence with volume - potential reversal signal
opportunities.competitive_edge: SPY momentum divergence with volume - potential reversal signal
buy_conditions: SPY shows a bullish divergence with a confirmed increase in volume over the last two trading sessions
RSI crosses above 30 indicating oversold conditions
Positive news or economic data release that could impact SPY positively
exit_conditions: Profit target of 5% reached from entry price
Stop loss triggered at 2% below entry price
SPY closes below the $620 support level
Negative news or economic data release that could impact SPY negatively

opportunities.opportunity: Tech sector rotation into defensive stocks - risk-off sentiment
opportunities.competitive_edge: Tech sector rotation into defensive stocks - risk-off sentiment
buy_conditions: S&P 500 index shows a decline of 2% or more over the past week, indicating risk-off sentiment
Relative Strength Index (RSI) for defensive stocks (e.g., utilities, consumer staples) drops below 30, indicating oversold conditions
Positive earnings reports from key defensive sector companies (e.g., Procter & Gamble, Johnson & Johnson) that exceed analyst expectations
exit_conditions: Achieve a profit target of 10% on defensive stock positions
Trigger a stop loss at 5% below the purchase price of defensive stocks
S&P 500 index shows a recovery of 3% or more in a single week, indicating a potential reversal in sector rotation
Negative earnings reports from key defensive sector companies that miss analyst expectations
